abstract.p: Chef Christian Delouvrier, formerly of Lespinasse, plans two restaurants, Terre, to open this summer, and Delluvrier, to open in fall; restaurant in Carlyle Hotel is renamed Dumonet, for executive chef Jean-Louis Dumonet (S)

block.p: It's been only a few weeks since Lespinasse, the restaurant in the St. Regis, closed, but its chef, Christian Delouvrier, has not wasted time. He has plans for two restaurants, one a country-style place, Terre, to open this summer at 861 Washington Street (14th Street), where he will serve terrines and rotisserie meats. In the fall he plans to open Delouvrier, 150 East 50th Street, with a more high-end menu, including food from southwestern France.

He has plans for two restaurants, one a country-style place, Terre, to open this summer at 861 Washington Street (14th Street), where he will serve terrines and rotisserie meats. In the fall he plans to open Delouvrier, 150 East 50th Street, with a more high-end menu, including food from southwestern France.

The restaurant in the Carlyle Hotel has been renamed Dumonet, for the executive chef, Jean-Louis Dumonet. The menu is Ã la carte, with appetizers mostly $14, main dishes $36, a plat du jour at $32 and side dishes, $8.
The Monkey Bar, 60 East 54th Street, has been turned into Steakhouse at Monkey Bar, with a $20 ''cut of the night'' at dinner.
Nook, an appropriately named new cafe at 746 Ninth Avenue (50th Street), has sandwiches, salads and main dishes that wander the globe.
Snack Bar, a new spot at 111 West 17th Street, serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Della Femina, 131 East 54th Street, has closed.
Luna Park in Union Square hires a different chef each season. At the stove right now is Joey Fortunato, previously of the Tonic.
